sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The copy of a petition presented to his Highness the Lord Protector, by Bassett Jones of Lanmihangel in the county of Glamorgan, against Colonel Philip Jones, one of his Highness council. With His Highness gracious order thereupon; the said Colonel's answer, and the reply of the said Bassett. To which, by way of an apendix, are added such papers as were made use of in the cause which any way tend to the clearing of the truth thereof. Jones, Bassett.
[2], 24 p.
s.n.], [London : Printed in the year, 1654.
Place of publication from Wing. Annotation on Thomason copy: "Sept: 8th". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
The copy of a petition presented to his Highness the Lord Protector, by Bassett Jones of Lanmihangel in the county of Glamorgan, against Colonel Philip Jones, one of his Highness council. With His Highness gracious order thereupon; the said Colonel's answer, and the reply of the said Bassett. To which, by way of an apendix, are added such papers as were made use of in the cause which any way tend to the clearing of the truth thereof. Jones, Bassett.
[2], 24 p.
s.n.], [London : Printed in the year, 1654.
Place of publication from Wing. Annotation on Thomason copy: "Sept: 8th". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
